segments.text: Have you ever thought about having children , Kaitlyn ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My husband and I have thought about it , but we've decided not to have any . They're just too expensive . Besides , with all the news about global warming on the news lately , who knows what kind of Worl
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I've always wanted to have lots of children . Growing up with only one brother , I always felt a bit lonely . What do you think about families with only one child ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: For me , growing up in a big family always made me yearn for attention . I always wanted to be an only child so that I could always do what I wanted and so that I wouldn't ever have to share .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Don't you think you would miss having other people around ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No way ! I spent 20 years of my life with relatives around me 24-7 . You know , I don't think I've ever actually spent any time by myself in my parents ' home . What do you think fo the one-child policy
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If China didn't have such a policy , can you imagine how many people there would be in China now ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's true . But as a woman , I'm glad that even though I don't want any children , I at least have a choice in how many children I have . On the other hand , I can't imagine what China would be like
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you think most families with many children envy or feel sorry for other families with only one child ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't know what other people think , but I , for one , envy only children !
segments.speaker: S2
